48403-d-11-15-83-RFP.Narrative: ON NOVEMBER 15, 1983 AT APPROXIMATELY 9:45PM, RF&P TRAIN NO 289'S CREW MADE A NORTHWARD MOVE WITH ITS LIGHT MOTORS INTO NO. 1 TRACK AT POSSUM POINT TO PICK UP TWENTY EMPTY COAL CARS. WHILE MOVING NORTHWARD INTO NO 1 TRACK, MOTORS RAN THROUGH THE SWITCH DIVIDING NO 1 TRACK AND THE LEAD TO VEPCO'S COAL YARD, WHICH WAS NOT PROPERLY LINED FOR THE NORTHWARD MOVE INTO NO 1 TRACK. AFTER COUPLING UP TO THE COAL CARS, 289'S CREW STARTED TO MOVE SOUTHWARD DOWN NO 1 TRACK. WHEN THE LEAD MOTOR,RF&P 138, STARTED THROUGH THE FACING POINT SWITCH THAT HAD BEEN RUN THROUGH ON THE NORTHWARD MOVE, MOTOR 138 SPLIT THE SWITCH POINT AND DERAILED, DAMAGING THE MOTOR AND RUPTURING THE FUEL TANK. ALSO THE FIRST COALCAR BEHIND THE SECOND MOTOR, RF&P 126, DERAILED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

K010-d-11-28-83-IRRC.Narrative: OUR TRAIN HAD ENTERED INTO THE CNW TRACK TERRITORY WHERE TRAIN SPEED IS 10 MPH AT MAXIUM. THIS TRACKSEGMENT IS OLD ROCK ISLAND RAILROAD PROPERTY WITH VERY BAD TIE AND RAIL CONDITIONS. NO REPAIRS HAVEBEEN MADE TO THIS TRACKAGE SINCE CNW PURCHASE FROM RI. OUR TRAIN WAS MOVING EASTWARD AT 8 MPH WHENSLIGHT CURVE AT WEST DES MOINES, THE 16TH CARS FROM HEAD END DROPPED DOWN INSIDE THE RAILS ACCOUNT OF WIDE GAUGE. THIS SPREAD THE RAIL FURTHER APART AND LET THE NEXT 4 CARS DROP DOWN INSIDE BEFORE OURTRAIN CAME TO STOP. THE CNW RAILROAD HAD A SWITCH CREW IN WEST DES MOINES YARD, LETTING US BY, WHENTHIS OCCURED. IN FACT THIS CREW WAS THE CREW THAT NOTIFIED US THAT WE WERE ON THE GROUND.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
